line_2: To visit a dull country friend:
To be a dull domestic friend?

line_1: From thy bright realms oh! kindly condescend,
line_2: To guard thy faithful, thy lamenting friend,

line_1: They think it mean, to condescend
line_2: To know a brother or a friend;

line_1: And now dear mourner will you condescend
line_2: To accept this offering from a constant friend?

line_1: Her fair and pensive sister condescend,
line_2: Enough, if her soft notes she sometimes lend,

line_1: Her fair and pensive sister condescend,
line_2: And chiefly thine, my ever partial friend!

line_1: And strive who most shall condescend.
line_2: Wolves, bears and mighty tygers bend,
On Vice or Folly to attend;

line_1: Above a Patron, tho' I condescend
line_2: Sometimes to call a Minister my Friend:
With Notes seraphic, to transport your Friend:

line_1: But Madam, if your Goodness condescend,
line_2: And one kind Minute, on this trifle spend;

line_1: Rare gift! yet, Walpole, wilt thou condescend
line_2: To listen, if thy unexperienc'd friend
ETERNAL TRUTH, thy steps to bend,
